activities.activityDescription: A mammogram is an X-ray picture of the breasts. Regular screenings for breast cancer may help catch the disease early, when it may be easier to treat.
Talk to a personal coach 3 times or complete any online program at your own pace. If you work with a coach, have 1 session over the phone and at least 2 more via phone or chat.

subActivities.activityName: Complete the General Wellness Coaching Program
subActivities.activityDescription: Learn the basics of nutrition, how to fit more exercise into your schedule, and how to manage stress.  Complete the General Wellness coaching program by talking to a personal coach 3 times. Have 1 session over the phone and at least 2 more via phone or chat.

subActivities.activityName: Complete the Stress Less Wellness Coaching Program

subActivities.activityName: Complete the Meditation Online Wellness Coaching Program

subActivities.activityName: Complete the Financial Wellbeing Coaching Program
subActivities.activityDescription: Learn tips and strategies to save more, build a better budget and sharpen your money management skills. Complete the Financial Wellbeing online coaching program at your own pace.

activities.activityDescription: Regular colon cancer screenings can help find cancer earlier, when treatment may be easier and more effective. A colorectal screening can include a colonoscopy, sigmoidoscopy, and fecal occult blood test.

subActivities.activityDescription: Regular colon cancer screenings can help find cancer earlier, when treatment may be easier and more effective. A colonoscopy screens for polyps or cancer inside the rectum and the entire colon.

Regular colon cancer screenings can help find cancer earlier, when treatment may be easier and more effective. A sigmoidoscopy exam looks at the colon, the lower part of the large intestine, and can detect colon cancer or other intestinal issues.

Regular colon cancer screenings can help find cancer earlier, when treatment may be easier and more effective. A fecal occult blood test looks at a sample of your stool to check for blood, which can signify bleeding in the digestive tract. It also may help find colorectal cancer.

A pap smear is a test that takes a sample of cells from your cervix to check for cervical cancer. It can detect cervical cancer early, when it is most treatable.
